achievements: Created iconic video game franchises such as Mario, The Legend of Zelda, and Donkey Kong.
Widely considered one of the most influential figures in the history of video games.
Served as Prime Minister of Japan four times.
Played a key role in Japan's post-World War II recovery.
Known for his innovative use of paper tubes and other unconventional materials in architecture.
Received the Pritzker Architecture Prize in 2014.
